revised_title: The Function and Structure of Fish Swim Bladders
tldr: The author, John Ray, discusses the function and structure of fish swim bladders based on the conjecture in a previous publication. He explains that swim bladders help fish maintain buoyancy and that there is a variety of structures and shapes in different fish species. Ray also mentions the absence of swim bladders in flat and cartilaginous fish and the role of swim bladders in eels.
